title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: India's petrochemical consumption growth to remain at 6-7% annually, capacity expansion to cut imports: Report
items.summary:
- CareEdge: domestic petrochemical demand to grow 6-7% annually in the medium term, driven by economic expansion and steady downstream demand.
- PP capacity to rise ~1.8x FY25–FY30, outpacing demand (~1.4x) and potentially eliminating PP imports by FY30, subject to cost competitiveness.
- Near-term margins pressured by global oversupply and cheap imports; profitability depends on cost competitiveness, global demand-supply, and need-based government support amid ongoing capacity additions.

items.title: New telecom security measures to accelerate indigenous manufacturing, cuts compliance burden: Jyotiraditya Scindia
items.summary:
- DoT/NCCS unveil reforms to strengthen telecom security while easing compliance to boost indigenous manufacturing and testing.
- Extend Pro Tem Security Certification for OEMs by 2 years; cut TSTL fees; 90% relief for women-led/MSME labs; 50% for others; waivers for government agencies and IITs.
- Align with DSS/Make in India/Atmanirbhar Bharat; expand broadband; build Swadeshi testing infra; position Bharat as a trusted global telecom hub.

items.title: From fortress to frontier: How 2025 opened India’s nuclear sector after decades
items.summary:
- SHANTI Bill 2025 allows up to 49% FDI via JVs and private players to build, own, and operate civil reactors with majority domestic ownership by NPCIL-linked groups.
- Focus on SMRs with ₹20,000 crore funding and a target of five indigenous SMRs by 2033 to supplement large reactors.
- Hurdles include high capex, new liability rules, insurance costs, regulatory clarity, and continued government control over sensitive areas like mining and waste.

items.title: Waaree Energies CEO Amit Paithankar to step down; Jignesh Rathod named CEO-designate
RIL denies report on govt seeking $30 billion compensation
India sits on huge rare earth reserves but produces barely 1% of global output: Report
items.summary:
• Global REE reserves ~90–110 Mt; India ~6–7% (~6.9 Mt) but 2024 output was ~2,900 t (7th).
• Monazite-rich coastal sands with thorium trigger strict rules; processing capacity is limited.
• China dominates refining (~90%); India needs execution, processing, and value-chain build-out to translate reserves into influence.

items.title: Saibaba Shiprecycling in cross hairs of scrapping sanctioned oil tanker Sunflower, formerly Nolan
items.summary:
- A US attorney urged Saibaba Shiprecycling LLP to halt scrapping of MV Sunflower (ex-Nolan), OFAC-sanctioned for Iranian oil and tied to Viktor Artemov’s network for Hizballah/IRGC-QF.
- The vessel changed hands (Nebula Nautics → Jaliyan Sustainable Ship Recycling → Saibaba) and was beached at Alang on 24 November 2025 amid a Florida arrest-warrant backdrop.
- The case underlines Alang’s handling of sanctioned ships amid a weak market and the push for green recycling under the IMO Hong Kong Convention.

items.title: Two Chinese airlines plan Airbus jet purchases worth up to $8.2 billion
items.summary:
- Spring Airlines to buy 30 A320neo jets with a list-price cap around $4.13 billion, deliveries 2028-2032.
- Juneyao Airlines to sign an agreement for 25 A320-family jets, about $4.1 billion, deliveries 2028-2032.
- Both deals require government approvals; Airbus had clearance to proceed with 120 previously ordered jets, but progress on new orders remains awaited.

items.title: RVNL emerges lowest bidder for ₹201 crore wagon overhaul workshop in Odisha
items.summary:
- RVNL emerged as the sole bidder for a ₹201.23 crore wagon Periodic Overhaul (POH) workshop at Kantabanji, Odisha, under East Coast Railway.
- It will have a capacity of 200 wagons and be completed in 18 months, with no promoter or related-party transactions involved.
- The project disclosure was made in stock-exchange filings as part of normal business activity.

items.title: iPhone 16 becomes highest selling phone in India: Report
items.summary:
- Apple exported iPhones worth $2B from India in November, aided by local manufacturing growth.
- About 6.5M iPhone 16 units sold in the first 11 months of 2025, making it India’s top-seller; iPhone 15 also in the top five.
- Apple’s India push includes three new stores (Bengaluru, Pune, Noida), no-cost EMIs, FY25 domestic sales ~ $9B, and Pro/Max assembly started in India.

items.title: AI to be core selling point, as smartphone makers look to stand out amid rising hardware costs
Nvidia takes $5 billion stake in Intel under September agreement
items.summary:
- Nvidia bought about 214.7 million Intel shares in a private placement at $23.28 per share, totaling roughly $5B under a September agreement that helped Intel's finances.
- The FTC noted U.S. antitrust clearance for Nvidia’s investment; Reuters reported this on Dec 30, 2025.
- Market reaction: Nvidia stock down about 1.3% in premarket trading and Intel roughly flat.

items.title: Centre extends telecom equipment security certification scheme by one year, cuts lab testing fee
items.summary:
- The Pro Tem Security Certification Scheme is extended by one year to maintain testing and certification continuity until the full security framework is ready.
- Application fees for Telecom Security Testing Laboratories are cut and ONT device norms are simplified to speed broadband and 5G deployments.
- The moves aim to boost domestic manufacturing, shorten timelines, and sustain network expansion into 2026 and beyond amid cyber threats and geopolitical concerns.

items.title: Russian factory activity shrinks at fastest pace since March 2022, PMI shows
items.summary:
- Russia's manufacturing PMI fell to 48.1 in December from 48.3, marking a seventh straight contraction.
- Production declined for the 10th month, hit by weak demand and fewer new orders, while input costs rose and prices were raised.
- Employment contracted at the fastest pace since September; confidence in future output dropped to its lowest since May 2022 due to subdued demand.

items.title: Lupin inks licensing pact with Chinese firm for obesity drug
items.summary: - Lupin signs an exclusive licensing, supply and distribution deal with Gan & Lee Pharmaceuticals to commercialise Bofanglutide in India.\n- Bofanglutide is a GLP-1 receptor agonist for adults with type 2 diabetes and for weight management; Lupin gains exclusive rights subject to regulatory approvals.\n- The deal broadens Lupin's diabetes/obesity portfolio amid India's rising metabolic-health burden and a global push for Chinese biopharma innovations.

items.title: Domestic aviation industry estimated to post up to ₹18,000 crore loss in FY26
items.summary:
• ICRA trims FY26 domestic passenger traffic growth to 0-3% and raises the industry loss forecast to ₹17,000–₹18,000 crore on weaker demand and FX losses.
• Nov 2025 domestic traffic at 1.54 crore (+8.4% YoY); Apr–Nov 2025 domestic traffic about 10.96 crore (+2.2% YoY).
• International traffic growth cut to 7-9% (from 13-15%); sentiment dented by cross-border tensions, tariff headwinds and disruptions such as IndiGo cancellations and the Air India crash.

items.title: India's industrial output rises 6.7% in November led by manufacturing
items.summary:
- India's IIP rose 6.7% in November 2025, with manufacturing up 8% YoY.
- Growth was led by basic metals, fabricated metal products, pharmaceuticals and motor vehicles; mining up 5.4%, electricity down 1.5%.
- Use-based drivers show infrastructure/construction goods, intermediate goods, and consumer goods fueling the overall rise.

items.title: Western Railway commissions first Kavach System in Vadodara division, marking major safety milestone
items.summary:
- Kavach ATC installed on 96-km Bajwa-Ahmedabad section in Vadodara Division, first in Western Railway to become operational.
- System uses 23 towers, 20 Kavach huts, 192 km optical fibre, 2,872 RFID tags; monitored from Vadodara and Ahmedabad.
- Provides SPAD prevention, automatic speed control, collision protection, SOS and automatic level-crossing whistles with home-grown tech.

items.title: Samsung to introduce first in-house GPU with Exynos 2600
items.summary:
- Samsung is inching toward full ownership of its GPU stack by 2027; the Exynos 2600's GPU design is still licensed from AMD, with layout optimized for the 2nm node.
- The Exynos 2600 adds a Heat Path Block for cooling and closer AI/SoC integration, aided by recruiting US GPU experts since 2023.
- Only ~30% of Galaxy S26 devices will launch with Exynos 2600; the S26 Ultra stays on Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 globally, with a launch eyed for early 2026.

items.title: Alpex Solar secures ₹65 crore order from MSEDCL for solar water pumping systems
items.summary:
- Alpex Solar secures a ₹65 crore order from MSEDCL to supply off-grid solar water pumping systems under PM-KUSUM B.
- The contract spans multiple districts in Maharashtra and must be executed within 60 days as per the Letter of Empanelment.
- MD Ashwani Sehgal says the order demonstrates the company’s manufacturing and execution capabilities for large government programmes and reinforces PM-KUSUM B's push for renewable irrigation.

items.title: How India’s next wave of EV innovation will come from precision local manufacturing
items.summary:
- Precision local manufacturing becomes the core engine, tightening OEM–supplier proximity and enabling near‑shore, cost‑controlled production for Indian realities.
- Policy levers (Make in India, FAME II, PLI) and a plan for 50 GWh cell capacity push localisation, charging infra, and domestically produced batteries and electronics.
- By 2030, about 80 million EVs (30% private cars, 70% commercial; 80% two/three-wheelers) will drive a factory‑floor shift to software‑driven motors, BMS and energy storage co‑design.

items.title: DAC approves ₹79,000 crore defence procurement for Army, Navy and Air Force
items.summary:
- The Defence Acquisition Council approved about ₹79,000 crore in defence procurement for the Army, Navy and Air Force, targeting stronger precision strike, ISR and maritime-domain awareness.
- Army: loiter munitions for artillery regiments, low-level radars for small UAS, Pinaka long-range rockets, and Integrated Drone Detection and Interdiction System Mk-II.
- Navy & Air Force: Navy bollard-pull tugs, HF radios and leasing of high-altitude long-endurance UAVs for ISR; Air Force ATOL recording system, Astra Mk-II missiles, Tejas simulators, and SPICE-1000 guidance kits.
keywords: Integrated Drone Detection and Interdiction System Mk-II

items.title: Waaree Energies crosses 20 GW in ALMM-approved solar module capacity
items.summary:
- Waaree crosses 20 GW ALMM-approved solar module capacity in India; Chikhli facility adds 16.4 GW, total now 20.17 GW (incl. Indosolar).
- ALMM update adds more models from Chikhli, expanding offerings across utility-scale, commercial/industrial and rooftop, and introduces TOPCon and HJT modules.
- ALMM listing enables approved manufacturers to supply domestically sourced projects; Sunil Rathi highlights commitment to domestic manufacturing, efficiency and India's clean energy transition.

items.title: Waa Solar secures ₹225 crore order from MPUVNL for solar projects under PM-KUSUM Scheme
items.summary:
- Waa Solar has secured ₹225 crore orders from MPUVNL to deploy grid-connected solar plants under PM-KUSUM Component-C Surya Mitra Krishi Feeders Scheme.
- Projects will supply power to MP Power Management Company Limited with execution over 18 months from signing of the Power Purchase Agreement.
- The initiative aims to boost solarisation in rural Madhya Pradesh, improve farmer energy access, and accelerate distributed solar deployment.

items.title: 'Made in India' should become synonymous with quality: PM Modi
items.summary: - Modi urged states to boost manufacturing, ease of doing business, and strengthen services, tying Made in India to quality and Zero Effect, Zero Defect.\n- He framed India on the Reform Express with youth at the core, underscoring Centre–State collaboration for a developed, self-reliant nation.\n- The conference highlighted skill development, education and high-value agriculture to lift exports and empower youth with technology.

items.title: Israel's tech sector says more staff seek relocation abroad: Report
L&T wins up to ₹2,500 crore order for Hyderabad greenfield radial road
Jindal Steel to double structural steel capacity at Raigarh to 2.4 MTPA by mid-2028
items.summary:
- Jindal Steel and Power will double Raigarh’s structural steel capacity from 1.2 to 2.4 MTPA by mid-2028 via a new mill and upgrades.
- The expansion targets rising domestic demand for heavy and ultra-heavy sections in infrastructure, energy, and industrial projects and reduces import reliance.
- Post-expansion Raigarh will produce sections up to 1,100 mm in depth and 1,500 kg/m, among the largest in India, with Raigarh a key site alongside Angul and Patratu.

items.title: AI171 crash report due in 2026, aviation sector braces for impact
items.summary:
- AI171 crash probe due 2026; preliminary findings cite rapid engine fuel-cutoff and cockpit confusion; government says investigation is clean.
- DGCA probe, IndiGo FDTT impact, and capacity expansion with Navi Mumbai and Noida airports; Air India turnaround hit by supply chains and new tariffs.
- 2026 outlook: more airlines, wider networks and fleets (wide-bodies, A321XLR); airport development and IATA optimism for India's aviation market.

items.title: Shipbuilding push: Govt rolls out guidelines for two schemes with ₹44,700 cr outlay; incentives target capacity, competitiveness
items.summary:
- Two schemes SBFAS and SbDS totaling ₹44,700 crore to revive domestic shipbuilding and boost global competitiveness.
- SBFAS: 15–25% financial assistance per vessel with milestone-based funding; SbDS: greenfield clusters, brownfield upgrades, India Ship Technology Centre for R&D and skills.
- Funding: 100% capex for greenfield via 50:50 Centre–State SPV; 25% for brownfield; shipbreaking credit note; target 4.5 mtpa by 2047 and ₹96,000 crore of projects.

items.title: Fabless chip companies eye surveillance market play via edge-AI silicon
items.summary:
- Indian fabless startups Netrasemi, BigEndian and Sensesemi are building edge‑AI SoCs and surveillance‑ready silicon for domestic cameras, NVRs and stacks.
- They emphasize on‑device processing, security, privacy and local compute to reduce data backhaul, aiming for a sovereign stack amid talent gaps.
- By 2030 they envision secure edge surveillance in Indian cities and enterprises, with policy, capital and customers shaping the domestically designed stack.

items.title: Meta, Apple, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Netflix hire 32,000 in India in 2025 amid H-1B curbs: Report
items.summary:
- Indian headcount of US Big Tech rose 18% y/y to about 214,000 in 2025, driven by AI talent demand.
- FAAMNG firms hired more than 32,000 in 2025, with 3,000–5,000 active openings, spurring demand in AI/ML, data, cloud, cybersecurity and governance.
- H-1B curbs announced Dec 23 will replace the lottery with a wage/skill threshold from Feb 27, 2026, likely raising compliance costs and accelerating nearshoring and automation.

items.title: Bluebird Block-2 satellite expected to commence operations in coming weeks: AST SpaceMobile
items.summary: - Bluebird Block-2 (Bluebird-6) was deployed by ISRO's LVM3-M6 and is set to begin operations in coming weeks, marking ISRO's first space-based cellular deployment. - Bluebird-6 is the largest commercial LEO array (~2,400 sq ft), about three times bigger than Bluebird 1–5, delivering 4G/5G broadband to unmodified phones. - AST SpaceMobile targets 45–60 satellites by end-2026, with five launches by Q1 2026 and a cadence of one Bluebird launch every two months.

items.title: 11 cos propose investment of ₹2,800 crore in a month in Madhya Pradesh
items.summary:
- MPIDC received proposals totaling about ₹2,800 crore from 11 industrial units after allotting undeveloped land in MP, aiming to create around 4,000 jobs.
- Pithampur Sector 6 attracted the largest share: a ₹1,250 crore unit by Syam Sel & Power Ltd, with other projects in Sanwer, Meghnagar, and Bhavsinghpura.
- Officials say the surge shows renewed manufacturing traction, with faster land allotment and infrastructure critical to moving proposals to execution.

items.title: India can't rely on foreign algorithms; must build its own AI models to protect jobs, data, intelligence: Gautam Adani
items.summary: Gautam Adani urged India to build sovereign AI capabilities to avoid dependence on foreign technologies, arguing AI will define the fourth industrial revolution and that sovereignty protects data, jobs, culture and security. Speaking at the inauguration of the Sharadchandra Pawar Centre of Excellence in AI at Vidya Pratishthan, funded by the Adani Group, he called for AI to be built in, governed in, and aligned with India's national interests. He noted that technology has historically created jobs after initial disruption, citing India's mobile revolution and the expansion of non-farm employment, and said AI could empower 1.4 billion Indians with AI-powered capability for domains from farming risk management to global microbrands. A new MoU between the Adani Group and Vidya Pratishthan will deepen collaboration in AI research, engineering, and execution.

items.title: Adani plans ₹1.8 lakh cr defence spend to boost indigenous military capabilities
items.summary: - Adani Defence & Aerospace plans to invest ₹1.8 lakh crore to boost indigenous defence manufacturing, focusing on unmanned systems, guided weapons, sensors/electronics, AI-enabled multi-domain ops, and expanded MRO/training.- Drishti 10 UAVs inducted for endurance ISR; Agnikaa loitering munitions endurance; ARKA MANPADS readiness; MRO platform integration.- By 2026, aims to scale autonomous systems across air/sea/land, deepen MRO/training, and expand precision-strike capabilities in line with India's defence investment trajectory.

items.title: India gets its first standard for bomb disposal systems to boost security infrastructure
items.summary:
- IS 19445:2025 sets a dedicated standard for bomb disposal systems, addressing gaps with clear performance benchmarks for bomb blankets, baskets and inhibitors.
- It defines test equipment, range conditions and evaluation procedures to verify system effectiveness, aiming for voluntary adoption by procurement agencies, manufacturers and testing bodies.
- Adapted to Indian threat scenarios using international best practices, the standard supports security operations and enhances confidence of Indian manufacturers and operators (armed forces, police, civilian agencies).

items.title: Teema eyes North India expansion: Taiwanese electronic giant might soon enter Uttar Pradesh; plan to establish tech park
Obesity treatment drugs to be new growth engine for pharma industry: Sun Pharma
items.summary:
- GLP-1 obesity therapies could drive growth for India's pharma sector, aided by AI-enabled disease detection and personalized medicines.
- Industry leaders call for easier access to risk capital and stronger R&D incentives (RDI/PRIP) to turn India into an innovation hub, with 2026 as a milestone.
- Faster regulatory clearances and stronger public-private collaboration could translate scale into better patient outcomes and wider access to advanced therapies like GLP-1 inhibitors.

items.title: Rolls-Royce eyes India as third ‘home market’, plans major investment
items.summary:
- Rolls-Royce aims to make India its third home market after the UK, US and Germany, with a major investment to build an end-to-end defence and engineering ecosystem and a next-gen aero engine for AMCA.
- The plan includes co-design in India, technology transfer and joint ownership of new IP, plus MoUs with defence PSUs for Arjun engines and future combat vehicles.
- The investment targets the full value chain across defence, manufacturing and advanced engineering, including potential marinised aero-core derivatives and naval propulsion synergies.

items.title: Opening the door to India's next energy transition with SHANTI Bill
items.author: Amit Sharma, MD & CEO, Tata Consulting Engineers
items.summary:
- SHANTI Bill replaces the Atomic Energy Act, consolidates liability regimes, and gives AERB statutory status, enabling private participation and SMR-driven capacity toward 100 GW by 2047 with indigenous designs.
- It seeks foreign participation by limiting operator liability; AERB independence is debated; pilots for SMR clusters include four actions: independent guidance body, brownfield siting, risk pooling, and stable funding.
- Amit Sharma of Tata Consulting Engineers frames engineering as opportunity and responsibility, pledging partnership with government to build a safe, reliable, clean nuclear programme.

items.title: India’s logistics sector shifts gears from asset build-out to digital integration
items.summary: - India’s logistics is shifting from asset expansion to digital interoperability, with ULIP linking 125+ APIs for real-time data across road, rail, ports and waterways.\n- GST, FASTag, E-Way Bill and the PM Gati Shakti plan push policy reforms and cross-ministry planning under the National Logistics Policy.\n- Main challenges include uneven interoperability, fragmented governance and risk of excluding small operators; success depends on private adoption and data-driven metrics to cut costs.

items.title: Government unveils ₹44,700 crore shipbuilding push to boost domestic capacity
items.summary:
- Unveils ₹44,700 crore shipbuilding push with SBFAS and SbDS, aiming to back ~₹96,000 crore of projects and create jobs over a decade.
- SBFAS: 15–25% per-vessel subsidies with milestone-linked disbursement; SbDS: 100% capital for greenfield clusters via 50:50 Centre–State SPVs and 25% for brownfield upgrades.
- National Shipbuilding Mission, India Ship Technology Centre, and Shipbreaking Credit Note to spur circular economy and strengthen project bankability.

items.title: Big roles drive India Inc's CXO mobility in 2025
items.summary:
- Xpheno’s dipstick of 47,300 C‑suite pros (2025) shows churn highest for CHROs (22%), CSOs (17%), and CMOs (12%), but absolute moves are small due to smaller bases.
- Larger roles see more moves in absolute terms: CEOs (3%), CFOs (11%), COOs (9%), with ~800 moves for CEOs and CFOs each—about 24% of total leadership changes apiece.
- Tech 30% of CXOs, 4.5% churn; Manufacturing 23%, 6.7%; BFSI 11%, 7% churn. These three sectors drive 1,764 moves in ~64% of the CXO pool.

items.title: Odisha to hold meeting on Jan 3 to finalise auction details for major, critical mineral blocks
items.summary:
- Jan 3, 2026 meeting to finalise the annual mineral auction calendar; Annexure-I (major minerals) and Annexure-II (critical/strategic minerals) map identified blocks with inputs from DMG, DoMG, OMC, GSI and MECL.
- Director of Mines and Geology to prepare a detailed PowerPoint; meeting will review block suitability, exploration status and auction readiness with attendance from IBM, OMC, GSI and MECL.
- Outlook: 35 major mines in 2026-27 calendar, with 6 critical mines in 2025-26 and 8 in 2027; all mines to be auctioned by 2026-27.

items.title: Punjab govt committed to making state preferred destination for MSMEs: Minister Sanjeev Arora
items.summary:
- Punjab govt commits to making Punjab a preferred destination for MSMEs through sustained engagement, reforms and Invest Punjab facilitation.
- MSMEs are the backbone; proposed investments over Rs 400 crore across auto components, logistics, cold chain, agri-infra and renewable energy.
- Arora pledges regular dialogue, policy support, and time-bound regulatory processes to speed approvals and project deployment.

items.title: Bridging the gender gap: Strategies for empowering women in India’s manufacturing workforce
items.summary:
- Targets skilling, safe workplaces, and gov schemes to boost women's manufacturing participation as India eyes a $5T economy.
- Actions: leadership programs, upskilling in automation, safer transport, on-site childcare, anti-harassment, bias-free hiring.
- Policy levers and models: Stand-Up India, PLI gender quotas, tax incentives, rural hiring, tier-2/3 plants, staffing-led sourcing.

items.title: FMCG companies refill all channels as GST dust settles; expect sales upswing
summary: GST dust settles: inventories across FMCG normalised, production at full capacity as firms rebuild stock ahead of a demand rebound next quarter.
Post-GST 2.0 channel disruptions ease as old packaging is phased out and re-pricing stabilises; Dabur expects H2 growth in the mid-to-high single digits with rural demand leading.
Industry-wide bullish on post-GST demand; with inventories normalised, GST rationalisation benefits are expected to reflect in sales in the near term.

items.title: India-New Zealand FTA means more jobs, incomes, trade: PM Christopher Luxon
items.summary: - The India–NZ FTA was concluded in December 2025 after rounds; tariff elimination on 100% tariff lines for India and expanded services offer.\n- It aims to boost jobs, incomes, exports, and labour-intensive sectors; introduces a 5,000-visa Temporary Employment Entry pathway for Indian professionals in skilled occupations.\n- It includes regulatory cooperation, simplified customs, SPS/TBT disciplines, and supports SMBs, agricultural productivity, and skill mobility.

items.title: AI data center boom forcing decade old, inefficient power plants back into service
items.summary:
- AI-driven data center demand is lifting electricity use and prices in PJM, reviving older oil- and gas-fired peaker plants such as Fisk in Houston.
- Utilities have postponed retirements for many peaker units as demand spikes, raising pollution and costs per kilowatt-hour while helping avert blackouts.
- The Fisk site sits on a former coal plant site, illustrating a broader trend of delaying retirements in PJM across legacy plants.
